carefuel.controller

Class PricePredictor

  • java.lang.Object
    • carefuel.controller.PricePredictor

  • public class PricePredictor
extends Object
    The PricePredictor class enables the user to predict the prices of a gas station up to one month in the future. It uses a pretrained tensorflow model that needs to be located in carefuel_basic/rnn_model.
    Author:
    nils

    • Method Detail

      • getGasPricesToID

        private ArrayList<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<Date,Integer>> getGasPricesToID(int gasStationID)
                                                                               throws Exception
        This function returns a list of all dates and corresponding prices of a single gas station with the ID gasStationID.
        Returns:
        the according list of dates and prices or null if file cannot be opened
        Throws:
        Exception

      • interpolatePrices

        private float[][] interpolatePrices(List<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<Date,Integer>> datePriceList,
                                    Date maxDate)
        This function interpolates the data given by 'datePriceList' at every hour linearly.
        Parameters:
        datePriceList - should contain a list of ordered dates and prices from the beginning to the last entry, where the last entry has to be slightly AFTER 'maxDate'
        maxDate - is the last date that can be used for the prediction
        Returns:
        Returns a two dimensional array of interpolated data. The first index corresponds to the month and second to the hour of the month, resulting in the shape [?][nHoursPerMonth]. The data is in reversed order and begins at maxDate.

      • parseDateString

        private Date parseDateString(String dateString)
                      throws ParseException
        This function takes a string representing a single date and time and parses it into a java Date object. The string is expected to be in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssz". It is important to notice that the offset from the GMT, indicated by the formatter z, is expected to be in the format +02, as it is in the data base and CSV files and not +0200 as it would be commonly used.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • predictPrice

        public int predictPrice(String maxDateString,
                        String predictionDateString,
                        int gasStationID)
                 throws Exception
        Convenience function. Calls predictNextMonth and calculates the price at predictionDate. See predictNextMonth for more information.
        Returns:
        the predicted price in cent * 10 at predictionDate.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • predictNextMonth

        public float[] predictNextMonth(String maxDateString,
                                int gasStationID)
                         throws Exception
        This function uses the neural network in order to predict all prices of a given gas station using for the next month since 'maxDate'. It uses all previous data before 'maxDate'. Note that 'maxDate' has to be BEFORE the last entry in the corresponding data set of the gas station.
        Parameters:
        maxDateString - beginning of the month at which to predict
        gasStationID - ID of the corresponding gas station
        Returns:
        the gasprices of the next month at every hour after maxDateString. The first entry contains the price exactly one hour after maxDateString
        Throws:
        Exception
